page.title: 01Farmland South of Seamer
page.content: A fertile and intensively farmed area along the flat valley bottoms of the Rivers Derwent and Hertford. Large fields and mainly arable farming utilise the fertile soils. No villages are situated in the block and most residents live inthe scattering of farms. The main York to Scarborough railway and the very busy A64 road pass through the block. In the south there is a caravan site which is a convenient place for tourist with transport to say for access to coastal and moorland locations. The block itself is not particulry attractive for tourists. There are a few plantations, mainly deciduous.
